definition: victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: We were kept on tenterhooks for hours while the judges chose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 我們坐立不安了好幾個小時，等着裁判們決定獲勝者。

sentences.english: What if Love and Compassion Win?
sentences.chinese: 如果關愛和同情獲勝會怎樣？

sentences.english: He knew that without this he cannot win, about that I have no doubt in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 他明白不靠這些他無法獲勝，對此我深信不疑。

sentences.english: It looks like Zou has a good chance of winning.
sentences.chinese: 看起來鄒市明大有獲勝的機會。

sentences.english: The winner is the first to draw three people in one space.
sentences.chinese: 在同一個中央先畫完三個人者獲勝。

sentences.english: I bet our team will win.
sentences.chinese: 我敢判斷我們隊準能獲勝。

sentences.english: The defending champoin won the first set, but the challenger took the second.
sentences.chinese: 擂主贏了第一回合，但是第二回合是挑戰者獲勝。

sentences.english: He romped home in the marathon race.
sentences.chinese: 他在馬拉松賽跑中輕而易舉地獲勝。

sentences.english: A slow runner will not win races.
sentences.chinese: 跑得慢的人不會在賽跑中獲勝。

sentences.english: When a party to, it prompts the other to win.
sentences.chinese: 某方用時到，則提示對方獲勝。

sentences.english: Whether right or wrong, Mr. A always wins the de- bate.
sentences.chinese: 不管是對是錯，A先生在辯論中總是獲勝。

sentences.english: The winner of each tournament will receive an exemption into the following months tournament.
sentences.chinese: 每輪賽事的獲勝者都將獲邀免費參加下一個月的賽事。

sentences.english: And pick fights you can win.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，這場惡仗才能獲勝。

sentences.english: I think their last win was just a fluke .
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他們上次獲勝只是僥倖罷了。

definition: to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
